result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Ramirez Colon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Case 14CF1027, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA sample/surcharge are waived based on date of violation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Continue to work on obtaining GED/HSED.
Agent to determine all other conditions they deem appropriate.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant Michael J Ramirez Colon in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on April 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Judicial transfer done pursuant to Chief Judge Order 11-SO-03(67) effective May 1, 2011 related to the assignment of new cases to the judge responsible for any cases currently pending for a defendant.  Cases 'currently' pending include post-judgment matters awaiting sentencing after revocation, modification of sentence, or any other action by a judge.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Anthony B. except as incidental with their employment, and not to discuss the case.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
